snippet: The Chinese policy that penalizes families for having more than one child has had psychological fallout for the children born after it was instituted in 1979, a new report suggests.
abstract: Study in journal Science shows that China's one-child policy has had psychological effects on children born after it was instituted in 1979, making them less trusting, less trustworthy, less competitive and more risk-averse than those born before policy.
lead_paragraph: The Chinese policy that penalizes families for having more than one child has had psychological fallout for the children born after it was instituted in 1979, a new report suggests.

headline.seo: Study Measures Psychological Impact of China’s One-Child Policy
headline.main: Study Measures Impact of China’s One-Child Policy
headline.print_headline: Study Measures Impact of China’s One-Child Policy
